ACT
109
When the assigned parts are considered a gift
If a child is born to the transferor after the transfer and distribution or an heir appears who was declared missing or dead, as well as otherwise when one of the transferor's descendants who are called to inherit him by law did not agree to the transfer and distribution, then what was transferred to the others it is considered a gift, and after the death of the ancestor, it will be treated as gifts made to the heirs.
